sub_title: Mechanical Commissioning Lead • BEng MEng MIEI • Hyperscale Data Centre
summary:
4+ years work experience in the construction industry, overlooking Mechanical, Electrical and other Building Services. I have been involved in numerous jobs around Europe working on commercial jobs (e.g office retail buildings, airport baggage hall upgrades) and Hyperscale DATA Centres.
Experienced and have been heavily involved in the delivery, installation and start-up of MEP equipment, as well as overlooking the design, installation, commissioning and handover of MEP works in projects.

I have expressed a great interest in the practical end of engineering, working with teams, assignments and projects. I'm an energetic, eager and highly dynamic individual who builds strong relationships within teams and with peers. I am an accomplished communicator with a creative and innovative mentality while completing targets/objectives under pressure within time frames. I'm keen to learn from others and improve my skills to support me through my engineering career and wish to excel and demonstrate that further within other organisations.

A Baggage hall upgrade for Dublin Airport and Cork Airport.
Including strip out and diversions of existing M&E services and install of new baggage conveyors, heavy scanning equipment and additional building services.
Works in T1 (Area 14, 6-Bay & 8 Bay) and T2 with 5 new Spines.
Includes a design and new build for a 5 storey Baggage Control Building (BCB).

profile_positions.description:
As a MEP Project Compliance Lead, my roles and responsibilities are as follows:

• Ensure all stakeholders are fully aware of and compliant with the management of any hazardous energies and any site-specific management strategies.
• Reprimand anyone observed undertaking unsafe work practices to their employer and escalate as required.
• Lead by example and ensure all stakeholders are made aware of Company specific Health & Safety policies and procedures.
• Liaise with client, client representatives, design teams, subcontractors, and vendors around the execution of project activities.
• Have a full understanding and knowledge of MEP department processes, procedures and plans and ensure these are complied with in the field by all relevant stakeholders.
• Ensure stakeholders receive sufficient information needed to progress the MEP installation.
• Review the master construction schedule to coordinate and track deliverables of project stakeholders.
• Coordinate, chair and input into onsite and offsite meetings with all relevant project stakeholders.
• Coordinate Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT), Factory Witness Tests (FWT), Site Acceptance Tests (SAT) and First of Kind (FOKs) tests as required.
• Attend project meetings as required.
• Assist and guide project staff in outlining compliance responsibilities and the resolution of issues.
• Provide the project team with updated information on current progress and risk items.
• Demonstrate compliance leadership and undertake on-site compliance audits of the MEP works.
• Coordinate training and demonstrations as required with respect to project specific requirements.
• Review and ensure project stakeholders produce and are compliant with the production of the below:
• Requests for Information, Technical Submittals, Risk Assessments and Method Statements.
• Progress reports and trackers reflective of their scope in alignment with schedule.
• All relevant project documentation, O&Ms and handover packs as required by the project.
profile_positions.title: MEP Project Engineer - Compliance Lead (Europe)

profile_positions.description:
As a member of the MEP department team, reported to seniors and assisted in these roles and responsibilities:

• Liaised with MEP design team and sub-contractors.
• Supervised, observed and tracked MEP installation in accordance to the programme.
• Organised and chaired weekly co-ordination meetings with the MEP sub-contractors and design teams.
• Ensured MEP sub-contractors produced the following documents: Coordinated MEP drawings, Procurement schedules, Programmes, Progress reports, Requests for information and Technical Submittals.
• Attended project team meetings as required and provided updates on MEP progress developments.
• Liaised with the utility suppliers to arrange for power, gas and telecommunications connections.
• Carried out regular site inspections and quality walks of the MEP installation to ensure conformity to the relevant standards, specifications and drawings.
• Reported and reprimanded any non-conformity to the project team and MEP contractors.
• Coordinated training and demonstrations of MEP systems for the client with the MEP sub-contractors and designers after installation and commissioning is complete.
• Having an understanding of the legal, practical and regulatory responsibilities, and a detailed understanding of Health and Safety.
• In conjunction with the Health & Safety Department, ensured that MEP sub-contractors submitted a safety statement and site specific risk assessment and method statement (RAMS) before commencing works.
• Ensured MEP sub-contractors were made aware of Collen health & safety policies and procedures and that health & safety was discussed at co-ordination meetings.
• Checked and confirmed adequacy of provisions within the site specific method statements relating to MEP works on site i.e., working with live electrical services, site deliveries, etc and co-ordinated these works on site.
• Assisted in the collation of the project’s safety file for project completion, such as O&M documentation and As-Built drawings.
profile_positions.title: MEP Coordinator

profile_positions.location: Industrial Development Agency Business Park, Tuam, Co. Galway, Ireland
profile_positions.description:
• Provided support to engineers with process improvement plan, the total loss replacement (TLR), and total rate production (TRP) plans.
• Adhered to Valeo safe-working requirements: wearing of PPE, LOTO procedure, knowledge and participation in emergency response teams, maintenance of machines in safe conditions, and maintenance of equipment safety features.
• Attended daily morning meetings to discuss progress in improvement plan and active projects.
• Observed COBOT machines and logged issues to create a vivid reaction chart and reactivity matrix for production floor technicians and operators.
• Created Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for the company’s database regarding various different scenarios and systems.
• Collaborated with Health & Safety by ensuring work-friendly conditions for operators on production floor were sustained.
profile_positions.title: Process & Methods Engineer

profile_positions.location: Smithstown Industrial Estate, Shannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
profile_positions.description:
• Worked in the innovation design department of the company in a pod with a team.
• Utilised Autodesk Inventor and AutoCAD to design, modify and implement components into machines designed for company clients.
• Attended and participated in department and team meetings for debriefing regarding various company projects and design concepts.
• Responsible for determining the parts and materials needed for a project and ordering them from suppliers.
• Contacting and communicating with company clients and suppliers to ensure the project is maintained well.
• Creating, inspecting and verifying detailed drawings for assemblies and part components.
• Practical and ‘hands-on’ work with automated machines in the workshop.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Design Engineer
